laazotea.indi.driver

Class INDIProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIProperty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    INDIBLOBProperty, INDILightProperty, INDINumberProperty, INDISwitchProperty, INDITextProperty

    public abstract class INDIProperty
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a INDI Property. The subclasses INDIBLOBProperty, INDILightProperty, INDINumberProperty, INDISwitchProperty and INDITextProperty define the basic Properties that a INDI Drivers may contain according to the INDI protocol.
    Version:
    1.35, November 11, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • INDIProperty

        protected INDIProperty(INDIDriver driver,
            java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String label,
            java.lang.String group,
            laazotea.indi.Constants.PropertyStates state,
            laazotea.indi.Constants.PropertyPermissions permission,
            int timeout)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs an instance of a INDIProperty. Called by its sub-classes. If label is null the label will be copied from the name. if group is null the group will be "Unsorted".
        Parameters:
        driver - The Driver to which this property is associated.
        name - The name of the Property
        label - The label of the Property
        group - The group of the Property
        state - The initial state of the Property
        permission - The permission of the Property
        timeout - The timeout of the Property
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty.

        Set the property to be saveable. Should only be called by property factories.

      • addElement

        protected void addElement(INDIElement element)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new Element to this Property (if it there is no other Element with the same name and it is already being init [not sended to clients]). Drivers must not call this method directly as it is called when constructing the Element.
        Parameters:
        element - the Element to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getElement

        public INDIElement getElement(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a particular Element of this Property by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Element to be returned
        Returns:
        The Element of this Property with the given name. null if there is no Element with that name.

      • getElementsAsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<INDIElement> getElementsAsList()
        Gets a List with all the Elements of this Property.
        Returns:
        the List of Elements belonging to this Property.

      • getElementNames

        public java.lang.String[] getElementNames()
        Gets the names of the Elements of this Property.
        Returns:
        the names of the Elements of this Property.

      • getNameStateAndValuesAsString

        public java.lang.String getNameStateAndValuesAsString()
        Returns a String with the name of the Property, its state and its elements and values.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the property and its values.

      • getXMLPropertyDefinition

        protected java.lang.String getXMLPropertyDefinition()
        Gets the XML code to define the property. Should not usually be called by the Drivers.
        Returns:
        The XML code to define the property.

      • getXMLPropertyDefinition

        protected java.lang.String getXMLPropertyDefinition(java.lang.String message)
        Gets the XML code to define the property with a message. Should not usually be called by the Drivers.
        Parameters:
        message - An message to be sent to the client when defining the property.
        Returns:
        The XML code to define the property.

      • getXMLPropertySet

        protected java.lang.String getXMLPropertySet()
        Gets the XML code to set the values of the property. Should not usually be called by the Drivers.
        Returns:
        The XML code to set the values of the property.

      • loadFromFile

        protected static INDIProperty loadFromFile(INDIDriver driver,
                        java.lang.String propertyName)
                                    throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Loads a property from a file.
        Parameters:
        driver - The driver which will include the property
        propertyName - The name of the property to load
        Returns:
        A property loaded from a file
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException - If there is some problem loading it (for example if the file does not exist)

      • setValues

        public void setValues(INDIElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Sets all the values in the Elements of and array of elements and values. Please note that this method does not make any assumtion about the values that are going to be set, so an IllegalArgumentException or an INDIValueException might be thrown.
        Parameters:
        elementsAndValues - The array of elements and values
